intro: Hexisea, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline environments. They have showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The leaves are usually palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Hexisea species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging coastal conditions.
